intro: Potentilla verna var. viridis, commonly known as green willow herb, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and features slender, often reddish stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers clustered in umbels, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a slightly serrated edge, often appearing bright green. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges, stream banks, and meadows.
